subject: chemistry
title: Varying Definitions of Acids & Bases MCQ Problems

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: According to the Arrhenius concept, what does an acid do when dissolved in water?
options: Increases the concentration of hydroxide ions
Increases the concentration of hydronium ions
Decreases the concentration of hydronium ions
Decreases the concentration of hydroxide ions
problems.hint: Arrhenius acids can release a \(\ce{H^+}\) which readily binds to \(\ce{H2O}\)
problems.detailed: An Arrhenius acid is a substance that, when dissolved in water, increases the concentration of hydronium ions (\(\ce{H3O^+}\)).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which of the following is a strong acid according to the Arrhenius concept?
options: Ammonia (\(\ce{NH3}\))
Hydrochloric acid (\(\ce{HCl}\))
Acetic acid (\(\ce{CH3COOH}\))
Water (\(\ce{H2O}\))
problems.hint: Strong acids completely ionize in water.
problems.detailed: Hydrochloric acid (\(\ce{HCl}\)) is a strong acid because it completely ionizes in water to produce \(\ce{H3O^+}\) and \(\ce{Cl^-}\).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: In the Brønsted–Lowry theory, what is an acid?
options: A substance that donates a proton
A substance that accepts a proton
A substance that donates an electron pair
A substance that accepts an electron pair
problems.hint: Brønsted-Lowry acids have a weakly bonded hydrogen atom
problems.detailed: According to the Brønsted–Lowry theory, an acid is a substance that donates a proton (\(\ce{H^+}\)) in a proton-transfer reaction.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which of the following is an example of an amphiprotic species?
options: Water (\(\ce{H2O}\))
Hydrochloric acid (\(\ce{HCl}\))
Sodium hydroxide (\(\ce{NaOH}\))
Ammonia (\(\ce{NH3}\))
problems.hint: Amphiprotic species can act as both acids and bases.
problems.detailed: Water (\(\ce{H2O}\)) is an amphiprotic species because it can donate a proton to form \(\ce{OH^-}\) or accept a proton to form \(\ce{H3O^+}\).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: In the Lewis theory, what is a Lewis acid?
options: A substance that donates a proton
A substance that accepts an electron pair
A substance that donates an electron pair
A substance that accepts a proton
problems.hint: Lewis acids are electron deficient species.
problems.detailed: In the Lewis theory, a Lewis acid is a substance that can accept an electron pair to form a covalent bond.
